abstract.text: The world data on yields and ratios of different Υ states created in hadron collisions at √ s = 19 − 8000 GeV are examined in systematic way. We find that Υ(2S)/Υ(1S) = 0.275 ± 0.005 and Υ(3S)/Υ(1S) = 0.128 ± 0.004. No signficant energy dependence of these ratios are observed within the broad collision energies. In addition, the rapidity, transverse momentum, and transverse mass dependence of these ratios are also reported.

Current data at RHIC demonstrate rapidly thermaliz-7 ing matter characterized by: 1) initial energy densities 8 far above the critical values predicted by lattice QCD for 9 formation of a Quark Gluon Plasma (QGP); 2) opacity 10 to jets; and 3) nearly perfect fluid flow, which is marked 11 by constituent interactions of very short mean free path, 12 established most probably at a stage preceding hadron 13 formation [1]. One of the important next objectives is to 14 study the color screening length in QGP [2]. Constituent 15 heavy quark-antiquark pairs in quarkonia are subject to 16 color screening and should be dissolved at high temper-17 ature. The dissociation temperatures of different species 18 will vary due to different radii and binding energies. The 19 precise measurements of transverse momentum (p T ) dis-20 tributions of quarkonia for different centralities, collision 21 systems, and energies will serve as a thermometer of the 22 QGP. 23 J/ψ is the most studied quarkonium at the RHIC 24 and LHC. In central collisions, J/ψ is less suppressed 25 in Pb+Pb at 2.76 TeV for 2.5 < |y| < 4 than in Au+Au 26 collisions at 200 GeV for 1.2 < |y| < 2.2 [3, 4]. A similar 27 feature is observed for mid-rapidity comparisons between 28 LHC and RHIC energies. Comparisons to model calcula-29 tions indicate that recombination plays a significant role 30 at RHIC and a more significant role at LHC. Further-31 more, the p T dependence of J/ψ suppression [4-6], the 32 flow pattern of J/ψ as a function of p T [7, 8], and the 33 high p T J/ψ suppression pattern as a function of cen-34 trality [6, 9], reported at LHC and RHIC, can be de-35 scribed consistently by model calculations incorporating 36 color screening and recombination features (See a recent 37 review article for details [10]).
